annotation_sentence: Not really. I sleep late. Uh, I watch too many series at night.
rationale: The phrase 'too many' is a quantifier used to indicate an excessive amount of countable items, in this case, 'series'.

annotation_sentence: Yes, I think I will try that. Any other tips for... um, health?
rationale: The word 'any' is a quantifier used to refer to an unspecified amount or number of something.

annotation_sentence: Ah, sometimes I forget. How much should I drink again?
rationale: The word 'much' is a quantifier used to refer to a large amount of something uncountable, in this case, 'drink'.

annotation_sentence: Um, I walk... sometimes. But not much else.
rationale: The word 'much' is a quantifier used to refer to a large amount of something uncountable, in this case, 'else'.
